stimulusHtml: Which of the following describes one factor that led to King Nzinga Mbemba’s statement that “our kingdom was already Christian”?

features.html:
“We...sent to your Royal Highness a letter.... In it we recounted the great victory which Our Lord had granted us. We explained that our kingdom was already Christian and we asked your Royal Highness to send us several clerics or brothers to teach us and to help us spread the faith. We also sent...our son and...our nephew, so that your Royal Highness may have them educated....”

Source: Letter from Nzinga Mbemba (Afonso I), King of Kongo, to Manuel I, King of Portugal, 1514

choicesHtml: The strength of the Swahili coast garnered the attention of Portuguese Christian missionaries.
The voluntary conversion of the kingdom’s nobility allowed Christianity to achieve wide acceptance.
The European introduction of the griot tradition of disseminated history supported the spread of Christianity.
The access to Trans-Saharan trade routes brought North African traders who introduced Christianity to the region.
